column4: how do i install java? it asks for root password if i input su. i am unable to change my root password through administration . i change it and then i input that password it says authetication failure
make sure u have codecs and video card drivers installed.. thats about it
yup i do have but there was some file to edit which i done in jaunty which increased my video quality (i guess it was on ubuntu's site)
i think that would be application specific
the file i edited had this at the end # Line commented out by installer because it failed to verify:
yup that was it i edited that and it increased all the display quality
your repository sources has nothing to do with video quality, editing that file wont do anything to your quality
yea it actually did (i had broken something and my totem wasn't loading so someone told me to do this and it increased the display quality and fixed the video problem (also VLC all other with video))
maybe its something that you installed AFTER adding the repository
i have a feeling you need to update or enable your video card driver... just a feeling.... as VLC uses its own codec files
